text:
I found that one of my webapps did not run in Tomcat 4.1.24 when Tomcat was
installed as Windows2000 Service (it runs fine with Tomcat standalone). I
debugged and found the following way to reproduce:

1. I Installed Tomcat as Service on W2K in the default location. It seems to be
important that the path contains blanks ("Apache Group/Tomcat 4.1", when I
install to "Apache-Group/Tomcat-4.1" it works).

2. I copied the ROOT application and renamed it to "test" to have a working
application. 

3. I created 50 (yes, fifty) duplicates of /common/lib/ant.jar (I used a shell
script and named the jar files 01.jar, 02.jar, ..., 50.jar) and placed them to
/WEB-INF/lib. It may also have to do with the content of the jar file, with
servlet.jar I could not reproduce the error.

4. When I now start index.jsp, I get the exception containing a usage help text
for javac:

creator: av@tonbeller.com
remm@apache.org
text:
Try instructing Jasper not to fork the Javac compiler to a separate in
conf/web.xml. I think this should solve it (it solved similar reports).

Yes, that fixes the problem.

Thanks.
creator: av@tonbeller.com
